title: Limited Social Protection for the Poorest
description: In 2021, only 4.68% of the total social protection and labor benefits reached the poorest quintile in Burkina Faso, indicating a significant gap in social safety nets for the most vulnerable.

title: Minimal Social Insurance Benefits for the Needy
description: As of 2018, a mere 3.01% of social insurance benefits were directed towards the poorest quintile, highlighting a critical shortfall in support for the economically disadvantaged.

title: High Investment in Tertiary Education
description: In 2016, Burkina Faso's government expenditure per tertiary student was 351.47% of GDP per capita, showcasing a strong commitment to higher education funding.
